text: I'm glad to see this game being a success, especially as a huge fan of Hempuli's previous game Environmental Station Alpha. I haven't finished it yet because it can get extremely hard, but it's a puzzle game like I've never seen before. The concept of moving around words to change the way the gameplay works is unique. If you want a great brain twister, search no longer.
author: SupraDarky

text: I haven't played Baba Is You yet, but the concept seems very similar to - or at least reminiscent of - Typoman, where you manipulate individual letters into different words which affect the world.
author: NeatNit

text: Hopefully he knows the extra and very meta things in this game...

text: This game's soundtrack is something. Really just a nice yet relaxing vibe to it.

text: I was just watching a stream of this! Such a charming game.

text: This game has one of the best plot twists I've ever seen in a video game. Which is incredibly mind-boggling given the fact that there isn't even a plot to this game.
author: yoshimario40

text: Criminally over looked game. Such masterpiece

text: How is it overlooked when everybody had been talking about it? For a puzzle game, it gets a whole lot of attention.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing

text:
@Burkhart von Klitzing well, good for you then. Because you sure live in a bubble.

There are many people that are clueless this game exists. Many many people.
author: Maicon Bert√©

text:
I've had this game since like April and I still haven't finished it cuz I'm stuck on every available puzzle. And I'm stubborn as hell when it comes to puzzle games so I haven't looked up the answers to any of em.

Still love it though, one of 2019's highlights for me. A lot of fantastic indie games have been coming out at the end of this decade - I look forward to what the 2020s will bring.
author: Dalton McBleh

text: Love the whole Baba Is You soundtrack!
author: Wispe
